description: Pisot sequence E(4,14): a(n) = floor(a(n-1)^2/a(n-2)+1/2) for n>1, a(0)=4, a(1)=14.
links: D. W. Boyd, Some integer sequences related to the Pisot sequences, Acta Arithmetica, 34 (1979), 295-305
D. W. Boyd, Linear recurrence relations for some generalized Pisot sequences, Advances in Number Theory ( Kingston ON, 1991) 333-340, Oxford Sci. Publ., Oxford Univ. Press, New York, 1993.
formula: Empirical: a(0)=4, a(1)=14, a(2)=49; for n>2, a(n) = 4*a(n-1)-2*a(n-2)+a(n-3). [_Harvey P. Dale_, May 02 2012]The empirical recurrence above holds for n<=6000. [_Bruno Berselli_, Sep 03 2013]
mathematica: RecurrenceTable[{a[0] == 4, a[1] == 14, a[n] == Floor[a[n-1]^2/a[n-2] + 1/2]}, a ,{n, 30}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, May 02 2012 *)
prog: (MAGMA) I:=[4, 14]; [n le 2 select I[n] else Floor(Self(n-1)^2/Self(n-2)+1/2): n in [1..25]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Sep 03 2013
author: _Simon Plouffe_
